ygData.messageBody:
I actually haven't done any of those trade skills
myself, I feel that it is terribly wrong to kill them.
Maybe a lowering of profit perhaps. Some people spent
a bunch of money on failures to bring their skill up
to master to make money, now they aren't going to make
any. Sounds like what they did to fletching, raised
skill check by 600%. People with 190+ fletching were
instant gods of bowmaking. It would cost 1000s of
platinum to get there now.

Belgarth Wolfstrider

--- Sean.Clark@... wrote:
> From: Sean.Clark@...
>
> Sorry guys....
> I have to side with Verant on Nerfing the
> Pottery/Brewing type skills.
> If you guys want to sit around doing these
> monotonous, boring vendor-type
> skills, than I guess that is your prerogative...BUT
> I sure don't see where
> you guys should be making 8-10 times the profit in
> an hour that a person can
> make out fighting monsters.
> Agreed, they seem to be going a little overboard
> with there 'corrections'.
> I don't think it should be impossible for you to
> make money selling made
> items to NPCs, but the amount of money that you make
> should be very
> comparable to what I can make out there gathering
> loot off of MOBs. My
> impression (please feel free to correct me if I am
> wrong!) is that you guys
> are the same group of people that made hundreds of
> millions of TONS of
> surplus Tailoring-made items in UO - you chose to
> spend time working up your
> Tailor so you could provide your mage with enough
> money to buy reagents.
> True?
> The point I'm trying to make is that you guys were
> taking advantage of the
> system...using in imbalance in the pricing structure
> to make a LOT more cash
> than you should have been able to make by using
> trade skills. Be happy that
> you got to take advantage of the system as long as
> you did. But PLEASE
> don't whine when they try to balance things out...it
> trivializes the real
> issues around game balance.
> Thanks for your time.
> Flame away :-)
>
> -----Original Message-----

> [mailto:belgarth_of_surefall@...]

> > -Kenny
